summary: This document is a chain of emails from March 2021 between FBI agents, a NYPD detective, and attorney Mariann Wang regarding scheduling meetings to interview new clients/victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss coordinating interviews for two new clients who allege abuse by Epstein and being trafficked to other men, with a focus on planning around a superseding indictment.

persons.name: Mariann Wang
persons.context: Attorney from Cuti Hecker Wang LLP who is representing new clients/victims and coordinating with law enforcement to schedule interviews for them to provide information for the investigation.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Copied on the initial email from Mariann Wang regarding scheduling meetings for new clients to speak with law enforcement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the perpetrator of abuse against the new clients mentioned by attorney Mariann Wang. The investigation into his world is ongoing.

connections.description: Mariann Wang copies Gloria Allred on an email regarding scheduling client meetings with law enforcement, indicating a professional legal association.
Mariann Wang is an attorney representing clients who are alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein, making her professionally opposed to him in the legal context.

events.title: Proposed Interview Date
events.description: Attorney Mariann Wang proposes a late afternoon meeting on March 17, 2021, for law enforcement to interview two new clients alleging abuse by Epstein.

events.title: Rescheduled Meetings Due to Superseding Indictment
events.description: An FBI agent suggests postponing the victim interviews until April 2021 due to a 'push to supersede,' indicating an upcoming superseding indictment in the case.

keyFacts: Two new clients of attorney Mariann Wang allege abuse by Jeffrey Epstein, with one claiming abuse occurred in 2008-2012 in New York and Palm Beach, and the other in 2002-03 and 2008-09 in New York, Palm Beach, and Sao Paulo, Brazil.
Both new clients allege they were trafficked to other men by Epstein, with Client 1 trafficked to 6-7 other men and Client 2 trafficked to at least two other men.
Law enforcement (FBI/NYPD task force) is actively coordinating with victims' attorneys in March 2021 to conduct interviews as part of the ongoing investigation.
The email chain references a 'push to supersede,' indicating active work on a superseding indictment in the Epstein case as of March 2021.
One FBI agent suggests a colleague sit in on the victim interviews to observe how they are conducted and hear directly from witnesses about 'Epstein's world.'
